panel.name: cool
panel.label: Cool features

panel.name: User Interface
panel.label: User interface
panel.text: Show the following buttons in the toolbar:

check_box.name: show_chat_button_check
check_box.label: Chat

check_box.name: show_im_button_check
check_box.label: IM

check_box.name: show_friends_button_check
check_box.label: Friends

check_box.name: show_group_button_check
check_box.label: Groups

check_box.name: show_fly_button_check
check_box.label: Fly

check_box.name: show_snapshot_button_check
check_box.label: Snapshot

check_box.name: show_search_button_check
check_box.label: Search

check_box.name: show_build_button_check
check_box.label: Build

check_box.name: show_radar_button_check
check_box.label: Radar

check_box.name: show_minimap_button_check
check_box.label: Mini-map

check_box.name: show_map_button_check
check_box.label: Map

check_box.name: show_inventory_button_check
check_box.label: Inventory

check_box.name: hide_master_remote_check
check_box.label: Hide the 'Master remote' volume control when useless
check_box.tool_tip: With this setting enabled, the small master volume button above the toolbar is automatically hidden when no voice, no media and no parcel music stream are present.

spinner.name: fade_mouselook_exit_tip
spinner.label: Fade mouselook mode exit tip/instruction after:
spinner.tool_tip: When entering mouselook mode, a 'Press SHIFT ESC to leave Mouselook' tip is displayed in the upper left corner of the screen. With this setting you can make the tip fade out after a number of seconds (minimum is 5s, with 0s meaning 'never fade out').

check_box.name: use_old_chat_history_check
check_box.label: Use the old style 'Chat history' window (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: The old-style chat history does not have a chat input line, gesture combo and Say button (these are already present in the toolbar chat line), letting more room for the actual history.

check_box.name: auto_open_text_input_check
check_box.label: Auto-open the text input floater when the chat or IM input lines are scrolled
check_box.tool_tip: When you fill up the chat or IM input lines with text, they start scrolling left to let you input more text (and up to 1023 characters) but then you loose visibility of what you typed at the start and editing your text is hard. With this setting checked, the Text Input floater gets automatically opened whenever the chat or IM input line is scrolled left for the first time when a new text is typed.

check_box.name: im_tabs_vertical_stacking_check
check_box.label: Stack IM tabs vertically (requires a restart)

check_box.name: use_old_statusbar_icons_check
check_box.label: Use the old, more readable, status bar icons

check_box.name: use_old_tracking_dots_check
check_box.label: Use the old T-like tracking dots in the mini-map
check_box.tool_tip: With this setting activated, the tiny V-like avatar tracking dots in the mini-map are replaced with larger and more visible T-like dots (inverted T for avatars below your own avatar's altitude, and normal T for avatars above). Note that whether this setting is enabled or not, avatars at the same altitude as yours are represented by a round dot, and avatars with an unknown altitude are represented by a dash-like dot.

spinner.name: decimals_for_tools_spinner
spinner.label: Decimals for Pos, Size and Rot parameters in the build tool:

check_box.name: hide_teleport_progress_check
check_box.label: Hide the teleport progress screen

check_box.name: stack_minimized_top_to_bottom_check
check_box.label: Stack minimized floaters from top to bottom

check_box.name: stack_minimized_right_to_left_check
check_box.label: Stack minimized floaters from right to left

spinner.name: stack_screen_width_fraction_spinner
spinner.label: Fraction of the screen width to use for minimized floaters: 1/

check_box.name: allow_mu_pose_check
check_box.label: Allow MU* pose style in chat and IM (with ':' as a synonymous to '/me ')
check_box.tool_tip: On MUCKs/MUXes/MUSHes/MUDs, to 'pose' or 'emote' you simply have to prefix your text with a colon (':'), while on IRC and in SL, you normally need to prefix your text with '/me '. It is of course faster and easier to type ':bows in greetings.' than '/me bows in greetings.'... With this setting activated, you can use either '/me ' or ':' to prefix your poses/emotes in both chat and IMs.

check_box.name: auto_close_ooc_check
check_box.label: Auto-close OOC chat/IM (i.e. add '))' if not found and '((' was used)
check_box.tool_tip: By convention and in most MMORPG, text enclosed between double parenthesis is considered Out Of Character text (i.e. text exchanged between players (example: '((Sorry, phone, BRB))'), in contrast with In Character text exchanged between their characters/avatars for the actual role-play). With this setting activated, you can omit the closing double-parenthesis and the viewer will add it automatically for you.

check_box.name: highlight_own_name_in_chat_check
check_box.label: Highlight posts containing your own name/nicknames in chat

check_box.name: highlight_own_name_in_im_check
check_box.label: Highlight posts containing your own name/nicknames in group IMs

line_editor.name: highlight_nicknames_text
line_editor.tool_tip: Enter a space or comma separated list of nicknames.

check_box.name: highlight_display_name_check
check_box.label: Highlight posts containing any (4+ characters) word part of your display name

check_box.name: spell_check_check
check_box.label: Spell checking in text and line editors
check_box.tool_tip: When spell checking is enabled, right-clicking on a misspelled word presents you with a menu containing suggestions for a replacement. This is the global setting (each line and text editor may have spell checking disabled, thus overriding this setting).

check_box.name: spell_check_show_check
check_box.label: Highlight misspelled words in text
check_box.tool_tip: When this setting is enabled, the highligthing (underlining with a red wave-like line) of the misspelled words is enabled by default in spell-check enabled line and text editors. Note that you always can toggle on and off the highligthing for each line or text editor via their context menu.

check_box.name: add_avatar_names_to_ignore_check
check_box.label: Add surrounding avatars' names to the Ignore list
check_box.tool_tip: When this setting is enabled, each time you attempt to auto-complete an avatar name by hitting the TAB key in the chat input (see the corresponding option in the Text Chat settings), the names of the surrounding avatars (avatars within chat range) are automatically added to the ignore list of the spell checker (keep in mind that this list is not kept after logout, so it would not affect next sessions), thus avoiding getting the names wrongly flagged as mispelled by the spell checker.

combo_box.name: installed_dicts_combo
combo_box.tool_tip: Choose the dictionary to use for spell checking.

text.name: downloading
text.tool_tip: A dictionary is being downloaded. Note that this operation is asynchronous and will complete even if you close the preferences floater.

combo_box.name: download_dict_combo
combo_box.tool_tip: Choose a new dictionary to download.

button.name: dict_download_button
button.label: Download
button.tool_tip: Click this button to download the chosen dictionary.

spinner.name: task_bar_button_flash_time_spinner
spinner.tool_tip: When IM/chat happens while the viewer window is not visible, the viewer sends an event to the desktop task bar, asking it to flash its button or icon. This setting allows to adjust the flashing duration (counted in seconds), or to disable it entirely (when set to 0). Note that this duration could get overridden by your desktop settings (e.g. it could use a given number of flashes instead of a duration).
spinner.label: Duration for the viewer button flashing in the desktop task bar (0 to disable):

panel.name: Inventory
panel.label: Inventory

check_box.name: rez_with_land_group_check
check_box.label: Rez objects with land group when possible
check_box.tool_tip: Setting the proper land group on scripted objects is important since failing to do it might restrict the permissions of their scripts (for example, the rezzing permission if the parcel is set to allow only group members to rez). This setting automatically takes care of setting the rezzed objects group to the land group, provided you are a member of that land group.

check_box.name: os_use_cof_check
check_box.label: Use the COF in OpenSim grids
check_box.tool_tip: The COF (Current Outfit Folder) is only used by the Cool VL Viewer to allow SSB (server-side baking) support. Since SSB is not implemented in OpenSim, you may not care at all about the COF and even want to be able to delete it altogether, unless you are also using another viewer relying on the COF to restore the initial outfit, in which case you will want this setting checked... Note that this setting would get automatically overridden for sims supporting SSB.

text.name: sound_action_text
text.tool_tip: The radio-buttons below let you choose which action will be performed when you double-click on a sound item in the inventory.

panel.text: Action to perform for double-click on sounds in inventory:

radio_item.tool_tip: With this option checked, the preview floater will be opened. That floater contains the description of the sound and two buttons to play it either locally or in-world.
With this option checked, the sound will be played locally (in this viewer only).
With this option checked, the sound will be played in-world (i.e. anyone around your avatar will hear the sound, unless they got sounds muted).

panel.text: Do not allow to wear more than one:

check_box.name: no_multiple_skirts_check
check_box.label: Skirt
check_box.tool_tip: While it is possible to wear more than one skirt, given how rendering is currently impemented in (all) viewers, the length of the combination of worn skirts is determined by the shortest one, even if it is worn below longer skirts, making it a mess... With this setting checked, any 'Add' action on a skirt wearable will be interpreted as a 'Wear', thus replacing any already worn skirt with the new one.

check_box.name: no_multiple_shoes_check
check_box.label: Pair of shoes
check_box.tool_tip: While it is possible to wear more than one pair of shoes, it does not really make any sense and beside, only the last worn pair determines the shape of the shoes (heels height, platform height, toes width and thickness, etc...). With this setting checked, any 'Add' action on a shoes wearable will be interpreted as a 'Wear', thus replacing any already worn pair with the new one.

check_box.name: no_multiple_physics_check
check_box.label: Physics layer
check_box.tool_tip: While it is possible to wear more than one Physics, only the last worn one is actually taken into account. With this setting checked, any 'Add' action on a Physics wearable will be interpreted as a 'Wear', thus replacing any already worn Physics with the new one.

check_box.name: thumbnail_check
check_box.label: Automatically show any associated thumbnail when selecting an inventory object
check_box.tool_tip: When enabled, and you select (left click on) an inventory object (folder or item) which got an associated thumbnail image, this feature auto-opens a thumbnail viewing floater. Note that this only works when the AISv3 inventory protocol is available (i.e. so far in SL only) and enabled (it should be, unless you disabled it from the Advanced -> Network menu).

spinner.name: thumbnail_view_timeout
spinner.label: Thumbnail view timeout:
spinner.tool_tip: Number of seconds after which a newly opened thumbnail view floater will auto-close (0 to never auto-close), not counting the time it takes for the thumbnail texture to fully load (i.e. the timer starts only after the texture is fully loaded). Note that this does not affect the inventory thumbnail edit floater.

text.name: thumbnail_view_timeout_text
text.tool_tip: Number of seconds after which a newly opened thumbnail view floater will auto-close (0 to never auto-close), not counting the time it takes for the thumbnail texture to fully load (i.e. the timer starts only after the texture is fully loaded). Note that this does not affect the inventory thumbnail edit floater.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for uploaded animations:

button.name: reset_animation_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the upload folder for animations to the default one ('Animations' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: upload_folder_animation
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where animations are uploaded. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for uploaded sounds:

button.name: reset_sound_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the upload folder for sounds to the default one ('Sounds' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: upload_folder_sound
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where sounds are uploaded. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for uploaded textures:

button.name: reset_texture_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the upload folder for textures to the default one ('Textures' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: upload_folder_texture
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where textures are uploaded. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for uploaded GLTF materials:

button.name: reset_material_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the upload folder for GLTF materials to the default one ('Materials' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: upload_material_folder
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where new GLTF materials are uploaded. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for uploaded mesh models:

button.name: reset_model_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the upload folder for mesh models to the default one ('Objects' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: upload_folder_model
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where mesh models are uploaded. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

panel.text: Inventory folder to use for newly created outfits:

button.name: reset_new_outfits_folder
button.label: Reset to default
button.tool_tip: Reset the folder where new outfits are stored to the default one ('Clothing' folder, at root inventory level).

line_editor.name: new_outfits_folder
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the inventory folder where new outfits (created with the 'Make new outfit' floater) are stored. You can choose another folder for this purpose from the inventory context menu for folders.

check_box.name: preview_anim_in_world_check
check_box.label: Preview animations on the avatar instead on a dummy before uploading

check_box.name: revoke_perms_on_stand_up_check
check_box.label: On standing up, revoke permissions for the object your avatar was sitting on
check_box.tool_tip: When you sit on a scripted object, it automatically gains some permissions, such as being allowed to animate your avatar. Some buggy scripts do not properly detect the moment when you stand up and may, for example, wrongly keep animating your avatar. This setting prevents this from happening since then all permissions get automatically revoked when you stand up. NOTE: in SL, only the animation and animation override permissions are currently (2013-09) revoked because of server-side limitations.

check_box.name: revoke_perms_on_stop_anims_check
check_box.label: On 'Stop animating my avatar', revoke the animation permissions
check_box.tool_tip: When using the 'Stop animating my avatar' feature and this setting is checked, the animation permissions granted to the scripted objects in the current region are revoked.

check_box.name: reset_overrides_on_stop_anims_check
check_box.label: On 'Stop animating my avatar', reset the animation overrides
check_box.tool_tip: When using the 'Stop animating my avatar' feature and this setting is checked, the animation overrides set by scripts (via the llSetAnimationOverride() LSL function) are also reset.

check_box.name: appearance_animation_check
check_box.label: Play the editing animation when entering appearance editing mode

check_box.name: turn_towards_selected_object_check
check_box.label: When selecting an object, turn the avatar around to face it
check_box.tool_tip: Normally, when you select an object by right-clicking on it while the camera is not focused on your avatar, the viewer automatically turns your avatar around if needed to face the object. You may disable this by un-checking this setting.

check_box.name: allow_multiple_viewers_check
check_box.label: Allow multiple simultaneous viewer sessions

spinner.name: bg_yield_time
spinner.label: Background yield time:
spinner.tool_tip: Amount of time to yield every frame to other applications when the viewer is not the foreground window. Do set this to 0 when benchmarking the viewer ! Note: when yielding, the FPS counter in the status bar turns white.

spinner.name: fps_limit
spinner.label: Frame rate limit:
spinner.tool_tip: Voluntary frame rate limiting, to lower the power consumption or heating. When rendering a frame at a speed corresponding to a frame rate above this value, the viewer will first attempt to use the 'free' time to complete ancillary tasks (so that no time is lost to rez new objects or textures), and then possibly sleep the CPU until the time corresponding to the requested maximum frame rate is exhausted for this frame. A value of 19 or less disables the limiting entirely. Do set this to 0 when benchmarking the viewer ! Note: when the frame rate is actually limited, the FPS counter in the status bar turns white.

check_box.name: speed_rez_check
check_box.label: Enable speed-rezzing via draw distance stepping
check_box.tool_tip: When activated, this feature automatically reduces the draw distance to 32m before departure when you TP away (or when you log in) and increases it back progressively to its previous value on arrival. This allows the closest objects and avatars to get rezzed first and thus provides a (subjectively) speedier rezzing experience.

spinner.name: speed_rez_interval
spinner.label: Draw distance stepping interval:
spinner.tool_tip: This is the interval of time, in seconds, between each increase of the draw distance (the distance is doubled at each step, till it reaches the value it was set to before the TP or login). The default value is 20s; if your network is slow, you might want to use larger delays (25s or more), while with a fast network shorter delays (15s or less) are best.

spinner.name: num_image_decode_threads
spinner.label: Number of image decode threads:
spinner.tool_tip: Number of image decode threads to use. 0 for automatic, based on number of available CPU cores. This setting will take effect after a viewer restart.

spinner.name: fetch_boost_after_tp
spinner.label: Duration of texture fetch boost after TP:
spinner.tool_tip: This is the time (after login and each far-TP) during which the texture fetcher will see its parameters boosted so to allow for a faster rezzing of the textures. 0 to disable. Note that boosting texture fetching reduces the frame rate (many more textures get updated at each frame).

check_box.name: teleport_history_departure_check
check_box.label: Log the TP departure locations into the 'Teleport history'
check_box.tool_tip: The teleport history always logs the arrival location. With this setting you may as well log the departure location.

slider.name: sun_position_at_login
slider.label: Sun position at login
slider.tool_tip: This slider is for setting a fixed sun position at login, or to adopt the simulator time (the latter normally being the default and corresponding to the leftmost position of this slider). NOTE: the 'Midday' setting provided in the 'World' -> 'Environment Settings' menu corresponds to 13:33.

check_box.name: ignore_server_mute_list_check
check_box.label: Ignore the mute list sent by the grid server
check_box.tool_tip: The Cool VL Viewer saves your mute list both on the server (like any other viewer) and in a separate per-user account file (this file is local to the computer); it also loads both the server-provided mute list and the local mute list file on login (the mutes are added together, so should one list lack one, it would be recovered from the other). In case the server mute list gets corrupted (for example, preventing you from removing a mute which would reappear on next login), you may check this box to fully ignore the server-provided mute list. Ignoring the server mute list also allows to keep separate mute lists on seperate computers (e.g. home and work) for the same avatar account.

check_box.name: ban_wall_render_always_check
check_box.label: Always render known close ban walls regardless of collision risks
check_box.tool_tip: When checked and when "View" -> "Show ban lines" is enabled, causes the parcel ban walls to be always rendered (when the server already sent the related info to the viewer, and when they are close enough) and not only when risking to collide with them (which is the default behaviour and quite inappropriate when driving a vehicle at high speed or with a high inertia).

spinner.name: ban_walls_max_distance
spinner.label: Ban walls maximum rendering distance:
spinner.tool_tip: The default for this value is 13, and may be varied between 10 and 50 meters. Please note that ban walls will nonetheless not always render below this distance, should the above setting be un-checked, or when the server did not yet consider your avatar close enough (or in risk with colliding with the ban wall) to send the ban lines info to the viewer.

check_box.name: os_bom_uploads_check
check_box.label: Upload additional bakes in OpenSim regions advertising bake-on-mesh support
check_box.tool_tip: When in an OpenSim region advertising bake on mesh (actually Universal wearable) support, do upload the additional bake-on-mesh-only bakes.

check_box.name: os_terrain_map_check
check_box.label: Enable the terrain map tab in the world map floater in OpenSim (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: OpenSim grids (so far) do not produce/transmit any terrain-only map tile. The corresponding tab is therefore not created when logged in on an OpenSim grid. A change in this setting is only taken into account after a viewer restart.

text.name: external_editor_text
text.tool_tip: This is the command to use for opening source assets or files (LSL or Lua scripts) with an external editor. Use %s for the filename in the command line parameters.

line_editor.name: external_editor_cmd
line_editor.label: Example: [CMD]
line_editor.tool_tip: This is the command to use for opening source assets or files (LSL or Lua scripts) with an external editor. Use %s for the filename in the command line parameters.

panel.name: RestrainedLove
panel.label: RestrainedLove

check_box.name: restrained_love_check
check_box.label: RestrainedLove mode (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: RestrainedLove allows scripts in your *own* objects to take control on some features of the viewer, and in particular restrict what you can do with it in given situations. This is used by many BDSM scripted toys to try and improve your role-play experience, but may also be used by other scripted objects not related with BDSM (for example, by a scripted outfit manager).

text.name: user_profile_text
text.tool_tip: This setting allows to set the RestrainedLoveBlacklist variable with preset black lists matching each user profile. You may also set a custom profile by clicking on the corresponding button, in which case no radio button will be checked here. Note that user profile changes will only be taken into account after a viewer restart.

radio_item.name: personna_player
radio_item.tool_tip: Persona-players are people who consider they make one with their avatar (their avatar is bearing their own persona, even if they do not share the same appearance or even gender). For them, IC (In Character) and OOC (Out Of Character) do not really mean anything (they are both IC and OOC at the same time when they play). They enjoy being restricted in the same way as their avatar and even further. RestrainedLove was primarily designed for persona-players. With this setting checked, no RestrainedLove command will be blacklisted.

radio_item.name: role_player
radio_item.tool_tip: Role-players are people who consider that, while their avatar may share some of their own traits, it is just a character (like the character in a novel) that they use to play a role. For them, IC (In Character) and OOC (Out Of Character) are two, entirely different things just like the writer of the novel (their OOC self), and a character in the novel (their IC self). They do not want to be restricted as a player (no OOC restrictions), but enjoy seeing their avatar restricted as a part of and as an enhancement to the role-play.

radio_item.name: non_bdsm
radio_item.tool_tip: If you are not into BDSM and yet wish to benefit from some features RestrainedLove can offer to you, such as allowing scripts to change what your avatar is wearing, or to redirect your chat (used by emoters), or to TP you automatically (used by teleporting gates), but do not wish to get restricted in what you can do in any way, then this profile is for you !

radio_item.name: custom
radio_item.tool_tip: Choose this setting to compose your own profile by selecting individual blacklist categories yourself.

button.name: custom_profile_button
button.label: Custom
button.tool_tip: Click this button to open the custom blacklist floater that will entitle you to blacklist groups of RestrainedLove commands.

check_box.name: restrained_love_no_setenv_check
check_box.label: Ignore @setenv commands (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: The @setenv commands are used to change the Windlight settings in your viewer. They can potentially get you into troubles if your graphics card and/or driver cannot cope with Windlight shaders (if you must keep the 'Atmospheric shaders' off in the 'Graphics' settings tab for the viewer to function properly or fast enough, it is likely the case). In this latter case, it is recommended that you check this setting.

check_box.name: restrained_love_allow_wear_check
check_box.label: Allow 'Wear' and 'Add to/Replace outfit' in inventrory
check_box.tool_tip: When this setting is checked and unless @defaultwear is in force, the 'Wear', 'Add to outfit' and 'Replace outfit' commands are made available in the inventory context menus even when an attachment has been locked on your avatar. Such commands may cause locked attachments to get kicked off your avatar, but RestrainedLove would then (attempt to) reattach them after a delay (see the auto-reattach delay setting below). If you do not want to risk getting your locked attachments accidentally detached (a few old ones may break when they are), or if the asset server is being too laggy to allow auto-reattach to work properly, you may want to un-check this setting.

spinner.name: restrained_love_reattach_delay
spinner.label: Auto-reattach delay for accidentally kicked locked items:
spinner.tool_tip: This is the delay after which RestrainedLove will attempt to reattach any locked attachment that got accidentally kicked off your avatar. The delay must be long enough to allow the item that got the attachment kicked to rez before auto-reattach is attempted, and for the sim to properly send the state (scripts states, especially) of the accidentally kicked attachment to the asset server before it is reattached (else, bad things can happen, like scripts forgetting last actions, recolored/resized prims forgetting their new color/position, etc). SL used to be extremely lazy (and laggy) with attachments rezzing/saving and 15s was a safe setting in the past. Knowadays, things have much improved and 10s should suffice in most cases.

check_box.name: restrained_love_forbid_give_to_rlv_check
check_box.label: Forbid giving items to the #RLV/ 'shared' inventory folder.
check_box.tool_tip: RestrainedLove devices may give you a sub-folder that would go into your #RLV/ 'shared' inventory folder and once this sub-folder accepted, they would most probably force-wear the items it contains onto your avatar (many 'transformation' devices proceed in this way). While you *always* can refuse such an inventory offer with the usual Accept/Decline permission dialog of the viewer, you may also want to force the viewer to put such accepted offers elsewhere so that items are not force-worn on your avatar once accepted. With this setting checked, the offered folder would go at the root of your inventory instead of inside #RLV/.

check_box.name: restrained_love_show_ellipsis_check
check_box.label: Show '...' for muted text when deafened
check_box.tool_tip: When your avatar is deafened and cannot hear chat, a '...' ellipsis is printed in chat instead. If you do not wish to see this ellipsis, you may un-check this setting.

check_box.name: restrained_love_emotes_check
check_box.label: Untruncated emotes (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: By default, and to prevent 'cheating' (by faking chat with emotes), RestrainedLove truncates emotes to a small amount of characters when your avatar is prevented from chatting. This is a huge impairement for true role-players who would not try and cheat but instead want to enjoy posing long emotes during their RP. While many RestrainedLove toys use '@emote=add' to lift such an annoying restriction, some do not. If you are a true role-player and do not want your emotes to be truncated when your avatar's chatting ability is restricted, you can check this setting.

check_box.name: restrained_love_can_ooc_check
check_box.label: OOC chat always allowed (requires a restart)
check_box.tool_tip: Out Of Character chat (i.e. text enclosed between double parenthesis) is normally always allowed, even when chat is restricted/muted by RestrainedLove. By disabling this setting, you may further restrict your ability to communicate with others by preventing OOC chat to go through when chat is restricted. Only the hardcore persona-players may wish to disable this setting...

panel.text: Instant Messaging related options (require a restart to take effect):
Message shown to people trying to IM you while you are forbidden to receive IMs:
Message shown to people when you try to IM them while you are forbidden to send IMs:

panel.string: THIS SETTING CAN ONLY BE CHANGED ONCE LOGGED IN.
